intro: Deyeuxia fuscata, commonly known as the dark-haired sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Native to temperate regions of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread and form dense mats. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
